Comment: As a Kentuckian, I hope Andy gets at least the Democratic VP nomination, if not the Presidential nomination.  He has won two statewide elections in now-deep-red (since 2004 or 2008, at least) Kentucky.  The first time, to be fair, he was running against one of the most-hated governors in living memory ([Matt Bevin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Bevin)); but he managed to win re-election in 2023 even despite the conservative opposition to his COVID policies.  **Edit:** And all that is ignoring his win for the (elected in KY) statewide office of Attorney General before he became Governor.  While he's by no means a progressive in the style of Sanders or Ocasio-Cortez, part of his last gubernatorial campaign was his unwavering support for trans folks.  The Republican supermajority of our General Assembly (legislature) managed to force through anti-trans bills over his veto, but he did the best he could do.  Also, if you do a web search for "govern me, daddy", he's right at the top.  So perhaps he has some populist appeal, which the national Democratic Party has been struggling with for some time.
